result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lemilton Gallion Jr

records.addlTxt: Letter form defendant re:  Request for a Copy of Motion Discovery.  (Lemilton Gallion, Jr. - #494919, Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, 1015 N 10th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Received and Filed: Notice of Expert Testimony

Defendant Lemilton Gallion Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Lemilton Gallion Jr.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Defense is requesting jury trial dates. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Letter from defendant.  (Lemilton Gallion, Jr. - #494919, Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, 1015 N 10th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Lemilton Gallion in court with Attorney Fred Richardson; both appear by video.  Defendant Lemilton Gallion in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 16CF948. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: B. Rutherford - MPD Officer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, defendant Lemilton Gallion not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defense counsel that defendant was in custody at last court date and remains in custody.  Court vacates stayed bench warrant. Case adjourned for preliminary hearing, Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for status of counsel. Previous date of 07-28-2022 rescheduled without defendant's knowledge. Defense counsel requests that the Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court not in sesson on 7/28/2022.  
Status conference rescheduled from 7/28/2022 to 8/02/2022 at 8:30 am, Branch 2.

Defendant Lemilton Gallion in court.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Off the record. Case schedled for indigency hearing. Defendant now qualifies for SPD representation. Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Indigency hearing on July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lemilton Gallion in court, appear by video.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Lemilton Gallion Jr
Current: 5760 N 95th Street #7, Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 05-18-2022)
Prior: 7415 West Sheridan Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Lemilton Gallion in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Lemilton Gallion not in court.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/13/22 @ 2:30p
